            BUILDING CHILD TF PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Venezuela Pubic
            Expenditure Management Project were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was high, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the implementation of financial
            administration reform projects benefit from the support from
            high-level political actors within Ministries of Finance; in
            spite of difficult political and economic circumstances,
            these projects have high chances of survival because of the
            strong interest of the government to obtain and utilize on
            reliable information; flexibility during design and
            implementation is essential to better reflect variance in
            the government priorities and needs; bank management should
            ensure the quality of documentation of Bank operations and
            the effective transfer of knowledge and the records from one
            task team to another; political changes have considerable
            impact on project design and implementation; project
            approval or signing around the time of a Presidential
            election or inauguration may be counterproductive even for
            technically sound operations; frequent or sudden changes in
            Task Manager may also be counterproductive; and
            participation and consultation devices are required at all
            stages of the project cycle.
